section.section: A hospital that intends to close or is scheduled to be delicensed shall provide the Authority and the Health Services Cost Review Commission with a written statement of any outstanding public obligations issued on its behalf.

A hospital with public obligations issued on or after October 1, 2008, that intends to close or is scheduled to be delicensed, shall provide to the Secretary of Health and Mental Hygiene a closure plan that is acceptable to the Secretary, in consultation with the Maryland Health Care Commission.
The closure plan required under this subsection shall include the plan of the hospital for the provision of care to its patients and to the population in its service area.

text.section:
The hospital shall file the items required under subsections (a) and (b) of this section:
within 10 days after the date of filing the written notice of intent to close under § 19-120(l) of the Health - General Article with the Maryland Health Care Commission; or
at least 150 days before the scheduled date of delicensure under § 19-325 of the Health - General Article.
